title: What are some things you are old-fashioned about? - Quora

response.answer_text: My values are conservative and libertarianI try never to use bad language or wear anything that is uglyI love men who open doors, raise their hats, go to the bar for me, and wear tiesI believe that sportswear is for sporting activities. Casual clothes are for casual people. Smart clothes are for smart peopleAn adult woman's engagement with the outside world requires shapewearWhen I married my husband I took his name and was proud to promise to “love cherish and obey”.I prefer people who do not know me intimately to call me “Mrs Jenkinson”.I listen to classical music, blues and jazzI go to a service in an old fashioned church every Wednesday and twice on SundayMy favourite writers are Hardy and Trollope.I don't wear trousers, only skirts and dresses, and do not appear in public without pantyhoseI like to handwrite letters with a fountain pen and use lavender-scented stationeryI rarely use social mediaI love old movies, the more romantic the betterMy house is full of booksI have a little collection of vintage gloves and admire the times when a lady did not leave her house without smart gloves on her handsNone of this is to imply I am prejudiced against more modern things and people, these are just my personal preferences

Hello, Ms. Jha, and thanks for the A2A! What am I old-fashioned about…? Nearly everything. I do all my own cooking from scratch, even pancakes and such. I don’t eat fast food. Even though I’m not a Christian, I still wonder if removing the morning prayer and Bible reading from elementary schools was a good idea. I feel part of our culture was censored. I dress conservatively, and never wear shorts, tank tops or miniskirts in public. Even as a teenager, I refused to wear such things. I dress nicely even to travel, and consider a professional appearance to be more important than my personal comfort. I don’t care for Political Correctness… at all. I think it’s dishonest. I write in longhand (“cursive”), and think people who don’t are lazy, and people who can’t are poorly educated. I firmly believe you can judge a person not only by the grammar he uses, but by the scope of his vocabulary as well. Basically, I live as if it were 1960. If I’m not behaving as if it’s 1960, I’m acting as if it’s 1890. One or the other, depending on the circumstances. You are very lucky I’m not in your family so you don’t have to put up with me!
